file.name: mandrillapp.com-1.0-swagger.yaml
file.content:
openapi: 3.0.0
info:
  description: >
    Mandrill is a reliable, scalable, and secure delivery API for transactional
    emails from websites and applications. It's ideal for sending data-driven
    transactional emails, including targeted e-commerce and personalized
    one-to-one messages.
  title: Mandrill
  version: "1.0"
  x-apisguru-categories:
    - email
    - marketing
  x-logo:
    url: http://mandrill.com/assets/images/brand/logo-vertical-light-735b5657.png
  x-origin:
    - format: swagger
      url: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/APIs-guru/unofficial_openapi_specs/master/mandrillapp.com/1.0/swagger.yaml
      version: "2.0"
  x-providerName: mandrillapp.com
  x-unofficialSpec: true
externalDocs:
  url: https://mandrillapp.com/api/docs/
paths:
  /exports/activity.json:
    post:
      description: "Begins an export of your activity history. The activity will be
        exported to a zip archive containing a single file named activity.csv in
        the same format as you would be able to export from your account's
        activity view. It includes the following fields: Date, Email Address,
        Sender, Subject, Status, Tags, Opens, Clicks, Bounce Detail. If you have
        configured any custom metadata fields, they will be included in the
        exported data."
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/exports_activity"
        required: true
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/exports_satus"
  /exports/info.json:
    post:
      description: Returns information about an export job. If the export job's state is
        'complete', the returned data will include a URL you can use to fetch
        the results. Every export job produces a zip archive, but the format of
        the archive is distinct for each job type. The api calls that initiate
        exports include more details about the output format for that job type.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/id"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/exports_info-response"
  /exports/list.json:
    post:
      description: Returns a list of your exports.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/api_key"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/exports_list-response"
  /exports/rejects.json:
    post:
      description: "Begins an export of your rejection blacklist. The blacklist will be
        exported to a zip archive containing a single file named rejects.csv
        that includes the following fields: email, reason, detail, created_at,
        expires_at, last_event_at, expires_at."
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/notify_email"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/exports_satus"
  /exports/whitelist.json:
    post:
      description: "Begins an export of your rejection whitelist. The whitelist will be
        exported to a zip archive containing a single file named whitelist.csv
        that includes the following fields: email, detail, created_at."
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/notify_email"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/exports_satus"
  /inbound/add-domain.json:
    post:
      description: Add an inbound domain to your account
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/domain"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/inbound_info"
  /inbound/add-route.json:
    post:
      description: Add a new mailbox route to an inbound domain
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/inbound_add-route"
        required: true
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/route"
  /inbound/check-domain.json:
    post:
      description: Check the MX settings for an inbound domain. The domain must have
        already been added with the add-domain call
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/domain"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/inbound_info"
  /inbound/delete-domain.json:
    post:
      description: Delete an inbound domain from the account. All mail will stop routing
        for this domain immediately.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/domain"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/inbound_info"
  /inbound/delete-route.json:
    post:
      description: Delete an existing inbound mailbox route
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/id"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/route"
  /inbound/domains.json:
    post:
      description: List the domains that have been configured for inbound delivery
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/api_key"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/inbound_domains-response"
  /inbound/routes.json:
    post:
      description: List the mailbox routes defined for an inbound domain
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/domain"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/inbound_routes-response"
  /inbound/send-raw.json:
    post:
      description: Take a raw MIME document destined for a domain with inbound domains set
        up, and send it to the inbound hook exactly as if it had been sent over
        SMTP
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/inbound_send-raw"
        required: true
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/inbound_send-raw-response"
  /inbound/update-route.json:
    post:
      description: Update the pattern or webhook of an existing inbound mailbox route. If
        null is provided for any fields, the values will remain unchanged.
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/inbound_update-route"
        required: true
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/route"
  /ips/cancel-warmup.json:
    post:
      description: Cancels the warmup process for a dedicated IP.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/ip"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/ip_info"
  /ips/check-custom-dns.json:
    post:
      description: Tests whether a domain name is valid for use as the custom reverse DNS
        for a dedicated IP.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/ip_domain"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/ips_check-custom-dns-response"
  /ips/create-pool.json:
    post:
      description: Creates a pool and returns it. If a pool already exists with this name,
        no action will be performed.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/ips_pool-key"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/ips_pool"
  /ips/delete-pool.json:
    post:
      description: Deletes a pool. A pool must be empty before you can delete it, and you
        cannot delete your default pool.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/ips_pool-key"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/ips_delete-pool-response"
  /ips/delete.json:
    post:
      description: Deletes a dedicated IP. This is permanent and cannot be undone.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/ip"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/ips_delete-response"
  /ips/info.json:
    post:
      description: Retrieves information about a single dedicated ip.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/ip"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/ip_info"
  /ips/list-pools.json:
    post:
      description: Lists your dedicated IP pools.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/api_key"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/ips_list-pools-response"
  /ips/list.json:
    post:
      description: Lists your dedicated IPs.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/api_key"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/ips_list-response"
  /ips/pool-info.json:
    post:
      description: Describes a single dedicated IP pool.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/ips_pool-key"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/ips_pool"
  /ips/provision.json:
    post:
      description: Requests an additional dedicated IP for your account. Accounts may have
        one outstanding request at any time, and provisioning requests are
        processed within 24 hours.
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/ips_provision"
        required: true
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/ips_provision-response"
  /ips/set-custom-dns.json:
    post:
      description: Configures the custom DNS name for a dedicated IP.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/ip_domain"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/ip_info"
  /ips/set-pool.json:
    post:
      description: Moves a dedicated IP to a different pool.
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/ips_set-pool"
        required: true
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/ip_info"
  /ips/start-warmup.json:
    post:
      description: Begins the warmup process for a dedicated IP. During the warmup process,
        Mandrill will gradually increase the percentage of your mail that is
        sent over the warming-up IP, over a period of roughly 30 days. The rest
        of your mail will be sent over shared IPs or other dedicated IPs in the
        same pool.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/ip"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/ip_info"
  /messages/cancel-scheduled.json:
    post:
      description: Cancels a scheduled email.
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/messages_cancel-scheduled"
        required: true
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/schedulingchange_info"
  /messages/content.json:
    post:
      description: Get the full content of a recently sent message
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/id"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/messages_content-response"
  /messages/info.json:
    post:
      description: Get the information for a single recently sent message
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/id"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/messages_info-response"
  /messages/list-scheduled.json:
    post:
      description: Queries your scheduled emails by sender or recipient, or both.
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/messages_list-scheduled"
        required: true
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/messages_list-scheduled-response"
  /messages/parse.json:
    post:
      description: Parse the full MIME document for an email message, returning the content
        of the message broken into its constituent pieces
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/messages_parse"
        required: true
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/messages_parse-response"
  /messages/reschedule.json:
    post:
      description: Reschedules a scheduled email.
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/messages_reschedule"
        required: true
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/schedulingchange_info"
  /messages/search-time-series.json:
    post:
      description: Search the content of recently sent messages and return the aggregated
        hourly stats for matching messages
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/messages_search-time-series"
        required: true
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/timeseries"
  /messages/search.json:
    post:
      description: Search the content of recently sent messages and optionally narrow by
        date range, tags and senders. This method may be called up to 20 times
        per minute. If you need the data more often, you can use
        /messages/info.json to get the information for a single message, or
        webhooks to push activity to your own application for querying.
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/messages_search"
        required: true
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/messages_search-response"
  /messages/send-raw.json:
    post:
      description: Take a raw MIME document for a message, and send it exactly as if it
        were sent through Mandrill's SMTP servers
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/messages_send-raw"
        required: true
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/message_send-status"
  /messages/send-template.json:
    post:
      description: Send a new transactional message through Mandrill using a template
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/messages_send-template"
        required: true
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/message_send-status"
  /messages/send.json:
    post:
      description: Send a new transactional message through Mandrill
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/messages_send"
        required: true
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/message_send-status"
  /metadata/add.json:
    post:
      description: Add a new custom metadata field to be indexed for the account.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/metadata_template"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/metadata_info"
  /metadata/delete.json:
    post:
      description: Delete an existing custom metadata field. Deletion isn't instataneous,
        and /metadata/list will continue to return the field until the
        asynchronous deletion process is complete.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/name"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/metadata_info"
  /metadata/list.json:
    post:
      description: Get the list of custom metadata fields indexed for the account.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/api_key"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/metadata_list-response"
  /metadata/update.json:
    post:
      description: Update an existing custom metadata field.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/metadata_template"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/metadata_info"
  /rejects/add.json:
    post:
      description: Adds an email to your email rejection blacklist. Addresses that you add
        manually will never expire and there is no reputation penalty for
        removing them from your blacklist. Attempting to blacklist an address
        that has been whitelisted will have no effect.
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/rejects_add"
        required: true
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/rejects_add-response"
  /rejects/delete.json:
    post:
      description: Deletes an email rejection. There is no limit to how many rejections you
        can remove from your blacklist, but keep in mind that each deletion has
        an affect on your reputation.
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/rejects_delete"
        required: true
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/rejects_delete-response"
  /rejects/list.json:
    post:
      description: Retrieves your email rejection blacklist. You can provide an email
        address to limit the results. Returns up to 1000 results. By default,
        entries that have expired are excluded from the results; set
        include_expired to true to include them.
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/rejects_list"
        required: true
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/rejects_list-response"
  /senders/add-domain.json:
    post:
      description: Adds a sender domain to your account. Sender domains are added
        automatically as you send, but you can use this call to add them ahead
        of time.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/domain"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/sender_domain_info"
  /senders/check-domain.json:
    post:
      description: Checks the SPF and DKIM settings for a domain. If you haven't already
        added this domain to your account, it will be added automatically.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/domain"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/sender_domain_info"
  /senders/domains.json:
    post:
      description: Returns the sender domains that have been added to this account.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/api_key"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/senders_domains-response"
  /senders/info.json:
    post:
      description: Return more detailed information about a single sender, including
        aggregates of recent stats
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/sender_address"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/senders_info-response"
  /senders/list.json:
    post:
      description: Return the senders that have tried to use this account.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/api_key"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/senders"
  /senders/time-series.json:
    post:
      description: Return the recent history (hourly stats for the last 30 days) for a
        sender
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/sender_address"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/time-series"
  /senders/verify-domain.json:
    post:
      description: Sends a verification email in order to verify ownership of a domain.
        Domain verification is an optional step to confirm ownership of a
        domain. Once a domain has been verified in a Mandrill account, other
        accounts may not have their messages signed by that domain unless they
        also verify the domain. This prevents other Mandrill accounts from
        sending mail signed by your domain.
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/senders_verify-domain"
        required: true
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/senders_verify-domain-response"
  /subaccounts/add.json:
    post:
      description: Add a new subaccount
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/subaccount_info"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/subaccount_info2"
  /subaccounts/delete.json:
    post:
      description: Delete an existing subaccount. Any email related to the subaccount will
        be saved, but stats will be removed and any future sending calls to this
        subaccount will fail.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/id"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/subaccount_info2"
  /subaccounts/info.json:
    post:
      description: Given the ID of an existing subaccount, return the data about it
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/id"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/subaccounts_info-response"
  /subaccounts/list.json:
    post:
      description: Get the list of subaccounts defined for the account, optionally filtered
        by a prefix
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/url_key"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/subaccounts_list-response"
  /subaccounts/pause.json:
    post:
      description: Pause a subaccount's sending. Any future emails delivered to this
        subaccount will be queued for a maximum of 3 days until the subaccount
        is resumed.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/id"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/subaccount_info2"
  /subaccounts/resume.json:
    post:
      description: Resume a paused subaccount's sending
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/id"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/subaccount_info2"
  /subaccounts/update.json:
    post:
      description: Update an existing subaccount
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/subaccount_info"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/subaccount_info2"
  /tags/all-time-series.json:
    post:
      description: Return the recent history (hourly stats for the last 30 days) for all
        tags
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/api_key"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/timeseries"
  /tags/delete.json:
    post:
      description: Deletes a tag permanently. Deleting a tag removes the tag from any
        messages that have been sent, and also deletes the tag's stats. There is
        no way to undo this operation, so use it carefully.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/tag_key"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/tags_delete-response"
  /tags/info.json:
    post:
      description: Return more detailed information about a single tag, including
        aggregates of recent stats
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/tag_key"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/tags_info-response"
  /tags/list.json:
    post:
      description: Return all of the user-defined tag information
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/api_key"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/tags_list-response"
  /tags/time-series.json:
    post:
      description: Return the recent history (hourly stats for the last 30 days) for a tag
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/tag_key"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/timeseries"
  /templates/add.json:
    post:
      description: Add a new template
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/template"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/template_detailed"
  /templates/delete.json:
    post:
      description: Delete a template
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/name"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/template_detailed"
  /templates/info.json:
    post:
      description: Get the information for an existing template
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/name"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/template_detailed"
  /templates/list.json:
    post:
      description: Return a list of all the templates available to this user
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/templates_list"
        required: true
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/templates_list-response"
  /templates/publish.json:
    post:
      description: Publish the content for the template. Any new messages sent using this
        template will start using the content that was previously in draft.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/name"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/template_detailed"
  /templates/render.json:
    post:
      description: Inject content and optionally merge fields into a template, returning
        the HTML that results
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/json:
            schema:
              $ref: "#/components/schemas/templates_render"
        required: true
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/templates_render-response"
  /templates/time-series.json:
    post:
      description: Return the recent history (hourly stats for the last 30 days) for a
        template
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/name"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/time-series"
  /templates/update.json:
    post:
      description: Update the code for an existing template. If null is provided for any
        fields, the values will remain unchanged.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/template"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/template_detailed"
  /urls/add-tracking-domain.json:
    post:
      description: Add a tracking domain to your account
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/domain"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/tracking-domain-status"
  /urls/check-tracking-domain.json:
    post:
      description: Checks the CNAME settings for a tracking domain. The domain must have
        been added already with the add-tracking-domain call
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/domain"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/tracking-domain-status"
  /urls/list.json:

          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/url_infos"
  /urls/search.json:
    post:
      description: Return the 100 most clicked URLs that match the search query given
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/url_key"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/url_infos"
  /urls/time-series.json:
    post:

          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":

                $ref: "#/components/schemas/urls_time-series-response"
  /urls/tracking-domains.json:
    post:
      description: Get the list of tracking domains set up for this account

      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":

  /users/info.json:
    post:
      description: Return the information about the API-connected user
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/api_key"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/users_info-response"
  /users/ping.json:
    post:

      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/api_key"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK

    post:

      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/users_ping2-response"
  /users/senders.json:
    post:

      requestBody:

      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":

                $ref: "#/components/schemas/senders"
  /webhooks/add.json:
    post:

      requestBody:
        content:

      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":

  /webhooks/delete.json:
    post:
      description: Delete an existing webhook
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/webhook_key"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/webhook"
  /webhooks/info.json:
    post:
      description: Given the ID of an existing webhook, return the data about it
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/webhook_key"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/webhook"
  /webhooks/list.json:
    post:

      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/api_key"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":

                $ref: "#/components/schemas/webhooks_list-response"
  /webhooks/update.json:
    post:
      description: Update an existing webhook
      requestBody:
        content:
          application/json:

              $ref: "#/components/schemas/webhooks_update"
        required: true
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/webhook"
  /whitelists/add.json:
    post:
      description: Adds an email to your email rejection whitelist. If the address is
        currently on your blacklist, that blacklist entry will be removed
        automatically.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/email"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/whitelists_add-response"
  /whitelists/delete.json:
    post:
      description: Removes an email address from the whitelist.
      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/email"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":

                $ref: "#/components/schemas/whitelists_delete-response"
  /whitelists/list.json:
    post:
      description: Retrieves your email rejection whitelist. You can provide an email

      requestBody:
        $ref: "#/components/requestBodies/email"
      responses:
        "200":
          description: OK
          content:
            "*/*":
              schema:
                $ref: "#/components/schemas/whitelists_list-response"
